means: 宣传（某事物）（尤指用广告）( publicize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: His model deeds have been publicized on TV.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的先进事迹都上了电视了.
他从未宣传过他的计划。

sentence.Network_en: He suffered a loss of prestige when the scandal was publicized.
sentence.Network_cn: 这件丑事公开后他便威信扫地.

PerfectNetExp.abs: should be publicized by all kinds of means ., 应当通过各种途径宣传它.

石油词汇英语翻译(P) ... publication language 出版语言 publication 发表；出版 publicity 周知；公开；公开性.

entry.def: If you publicize a fact or event, you make it widely known to the public.

example.ex: The author appeared on television to publicize her latest book...
example.tran: 那位作家上电视宣传她的新书。
他从未宣传过他的计划。

means.word_mean: 1. made known; especially made widely known

auth_sentence.content: The right's internal war over the debt ceiling was well publicized.
auth_sentence.res_content: The right's internal war over the debt ceiling was well publicized.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The right's internal war over the debt ceiling was well publicized.

auth_sentence.content: Many were put off visiting Macau because of its well-publicized gang war.
auth_sentence.res_content: Many were put off visiting Macau because of its well-publicized gang war.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Many were put off visiting Macau because of its well-publicized gang war.

auth_sentence.content: One blunder of one person...was fully publicized and used to tar the entire...organization.
